question.text: Which of the following correlations are incorrect?

options.text: There are seven free cervical vertebrae and seven pairs of cervical spinal nerves
There are twelve free thoracic vertebrae and twelve pairs of thoracic spinal nerves
There are five free lumbar vertebrae and five pairs of lumbar spinal nerves
There are five fused sacral vertebrae and five pairs of sacral spinal nerves

solution.text:
In the vertebral column, there are 7 free cervical vertebrae, 12 free thoracic vertebrae, 5 free lumbar vertebrae, 5 sacral vertebrae which are fused to form one bone called the sacrum and 4 coccygeal vertebrae which are fused to form one bone called the coccyx. Thus, there are 33 vertebrae and 26 bones in the vertebral column.

There are 8 pairs of cervical spinal nerves, 12 pairs of thoracic spinal nerves, 5 pairs of lumbar spinal nerves, 5 pairs of sacral spinal nerves and 1 pair of coccygeal spinal nerves. Thus, there are 31 pairs of the spinal nerve and all are mixed.
